Use your funds to renovate your home, pay your bills, save for the future, or anything else you need.

productTypeDefaults.descriptor: Fund your project with an installment loan and make fixed monthly payments with a fixed rate
productTypeDefaults.label: Personal Loan
productTypeDefaults.tooltip:
With a Personal Loan, you borrow money now and pay it back over time with fixed monthly payments.
  • Personal loans have fixed rates of interest, and terms that typically range from 2 to 12 years.
  • They may be unsecured (no collateral) or secured (collateral required such as an automobile or home fixtures).
productTypeDefaults.footer: See other important information below about Acorn Finance and the offers on this page*

productTypeDefaults.descriptor: Fund your project and borrow for other expenses up to a preset credit limit
productTypeDefaults.label: Personal Credit Line
productTypeDefaults.tooltip:
With a Personal Credit Line, you get the ability to borrow money at any time up to a preset limit.
  • As long as your account is open and your credit remains in good standing, you can borrow up to the maximum amount and pay interest only on the amount you actually borrow.
  • As you pay the balance off over time, that credit may once again become available for you to borrow from.
  • Credit cards are one type of Personal Credit Line (but not all credit lines come with a physical card).
productTypeDefaults.explainer: The Monthly Payment Estimate reflects the approximate payment needed to pay the Charge Amount within the Payoff Period, as shown above. The Charge Amount is the lesser of (a) your requested loan amount and (b) the maximum amount you can charge on this credit line. The Monthly Payment Estimate is calculated by Acorn and may differ from the minimum monthly payment set by the lender.
productTypeDefaults.footer: See other important information below about Acorn Finance and the offers on this page*

productTypeDefaults.descriptor: Fund your project with a secured loan and make fixed monthly payments with a fixed rate
productTypeDefaults.label: Home Equity Loan
productTypeDefaults.tooltip:
With a Home Equity Loan, you borrow money now and pay it back over time with fixed monthly payments.
  • Home Equity Loans have fixed rates of interest, and terms that typically range from 5 to 30 years.
  • They are secured by the equity value in your home, so typically have lower rates than personal loans or other unsecured offers (your equity value is the market price of your home minus the balance left on your mortgage).
  • Home Equity Loans are also known as second mortgages or junior liens.
productTypeDefaults.footer: See other important information below about Acorn Finance and the offers on this page*

productTypeDefaults.descriptor: Fund your project by unlocking your home equity
productTypeDefaults.label: Home Equity Investment
productTypeDefaults.tooltip:
With a Home Equity Investment (HEI), you get cash now in exchange for a share of your home’s future appreciation.
  • There are no monthly payments.
  • Instead, you get a partner in your home. It’s equity financing for homeowners.
  • Any time within the term of the HEI, you pay back what you received, plus an agreed-upon percentage of your home’s appreciation (typically through a home sale, refinance, or another source of funds).
productTypeDefaults.explainer: While there is no Monthly Payment, you must pay back the funding amount plus a share of your home's future appreciation before the end of the term.
productTypeDefaults.footer: See other important information below about Acorn Finance and the offers on this page*

disclaimer.title: ADVERTISER DISCLOSURE
disclaimer.detail: *The offers that appear on this site are from third party advertisers from which Acorn Finance receives compensation. This compensation may impact how and where products appear on this site (including, for example, the order in which they appear). Acorn Finance strives to present a wide array of offers, but the offers shown do not represent all financial services companies or products that may be available to you.

disclaimer.title: DISCLAIMER
disclaimer.detail: Information used in this tool has been gathered from the lenders’ websites and other publicly available sources. While we do our best to ensure our information is up to date and calculations are accurate, all information is presented without warranty. If you find information or calculations you believe to be in error, please contact us. Estimated interest rate, APR, and other terms are not binding in any way. Your actual interest rate and APR will depend on factors like credit score, requested loan amount, loan term, and credit history. Only borrowers with excellent credit will qualify for the lowest rate. All loans are subject to credit review and approval by our lender partners.Offers represent lowest monthly payment for amount and term displayed. When evaluating offers, please review the lender’s terms and conditions for additional details. The operator of this website is not a lender, does not broker loans to lenders and does not make personal loans or credit decisions. This website does not constitute an offer or solicitation to lend. This website will submit the information you provide to a lender. Providing your information on this website does not guarantee that you will be approved for a personal loan. The operator of this website is not an agent, representative or broker of any lender and does not endorse or charge you for any service or product.
